meanings.definition: Lying on the same straight line or in the same plane.
meanings.sent1: The two buildings were coaxal, perfectly aligned in a row.
meanings.sent2: The artist ensured that the frames of the paintings were coaxal on the gallery wall.
meanings.sent3: The coaxal trees in the garden looked like soldiers standing in formation.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts and emotions seemed coaxal, all in sync and harmonious.
meanings.sent5: The coaxal arrangement of the books on the shelf made it easy to find each one.

meanings.sent1: The coaxal wheels of the bicycle spun smoothly as he rode down the street.
meanings.sent2: The gears in the machine were designed to be coaxal for optimal performance.
meanings.sent3: The coaxal planets in the solar system seemed to dance around the sun.
meanings.sent4: Their interests were coaxal, revolving around a shared passion for music.
meanings.sent5: The coaxal alignment of the stars in the sky created a mesmerizing pattern.
